page.title: 03THE CATTLE MARKET AT SLOUGH
page.content: We went to the Cattle Market on Tuesday, which was auction day, so it was packed with buyers and sellers. The animals came from nearby farms and the customers came from a 15 mile radius. What people looked for in an animal was health, strength and quality, and the animal must match the purpose the buyer requires. There were bulls, cows, calves, pigs and piglets for sale. When we came the calves were up for auction. The pigs were usually sold and slaughtered for meat. Apart from farm animals, rabbits, ducks, geese, hens and chickens were sold. Farm equipment was also being sold. The cows and other animals were waiting in pens. There was a nasty smell. The pens which the animals were in, were dirty and wet.
